name: 文學與文化研究實作專題（二）
goals: to plan the chapter structure of the MA dissertation
Offer insight and guidance to students’ writing and research methodology
syllabus:
**\[Course duration: 16 weeks+2 flex weeks (in-class teaching optional)\]** This course applies combined teaching methods including lecture, problem-based learning, group discussion, idea sharing, and group project. We encourage students to be autonomous learners. Long-distance, online instruction may be implemented according to the university’s instruction of the pandemic situation.

In the first week, a line group will be set up for the class. Those students who have enrolled in the course "Research Practices of Literature and Cultural Studies (II)" will have to join the course line group in the first week’s class.  If you are interested in this course but fail to enroll in it during the add/drop course period, you may contact the course TAs (Alan Wang, **rockdtenebris@gmail.com**; Ivana Lee,  **wind0507@gmail.com**). They will guide you to have access to the course moodle platform and the line group. The teaching mode may be adjusted according to the university’s guideline of the epidemic situation.

**Should there be any outbreak of the Covid-19 pandemic, the course will adopt the following teaching modes according to the university’s regulations:**

(a)   All the teaching materials will be uploaded to Moodle. By using the online meeting software and Moodle platform, students can submit their homework, take examinations, make presentations, and discuss with other classmates online.

(b)  The course PPTs and the audio/video lecture recordings will be uploaded to Moodle.

(c)   Synchronous online teaching may be implemented. 

**A warm reminder:  If you do not feel well and have the following syndromes: coughing badly, having a fever (forehead or ear temperature exceeding 37.5 degrees Celsius), any chest discomfort, feeling headache or nausea, etc., we strongly suggest that you go for medical consultation, STAY AT HOME, ask a sick leave in moodle, and take good care of yourself. We wish you good health and a happy beginning of the semester!**

**Course Etiquette and guidelines During the COVID-19 pandemic:**

**1.    Please observe the rule of physical distancing and be respectful of others' space.**

**2.    Using hand sanitizer and reporting measurement of body temperature before class are compulsory.**

**3.    Everyone is required to wear a mask in class.**

**4.    Make sure to keep all windows and door(s) of the classroom open during the class.**

**5.    You may be excused to ask a sick leave if you have symptoms of suspected Covid-19 infection or feel ill.**

**6.  If long-distance teaching is implemented, the webcam will not be turned on in class unless necessary.**

methodologies.note: guiding students to search for appropriate topics and methods to prepare themselves for writing an MA thesis
learning problem-solving skills of developing workable critical arguments
sharing ideas through group discussion and presentation
learning how to compile a reading list through practice
working out specific topics related to students' MA thesis through brainstorming discussion and consultation
